org.jpws.front.util

Class DialogButtonBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.jpws.front.util.ButtonBar
              • org.jpws.front.util.DialogButtonBar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DialogButtonBar
extends ButtonBar
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.lang.Cloneable
    Creates a ButtonBar containing minimal NO button. Typically it contains at least an "Ok" or a "Close" button. Depending on init settings, additional elements are "Cancel" and "Help" buttons. Moreover custom components (which ideally are JButton or JComboBox) may be added to this bar.

    The application can setup a ButtonBarListener in order to specifically react to button/component actions performed by the user. If there is no listener supplied, this bar disposes the first JDialog into which it is placed upon activation of "Ok", "Close" or "Cancel".

    Author:
    Wolfgang Keller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • performButton

        public void performButton(java.lang.Object button)
        Performs actions of this button bar related to one of its registered buttons. The performance is equivalent to the event of a button pressed or component activated. Does nothing if the parameter is void.
        Parameters:
        button - button or component triggered

      • joinButtonThreads

        public void joinButtonThreads()
        Blocks execution of the current thread until all tasks triggered by buttons of this bar have been executed.
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • setSynchronous

        public void setSynchronous(boolean v)
        Sets whether button triggered actions will run on the Event Dispatching Thread (EDT) (v == true) or on a separate threads (v == false).
        Parameters:
        v - boolean

      • addButtonBarListener

        public void addButtonBarListener(ButtonBarListener listener)
        Adds a ButtonBarListener for this bar that will handle button actions according to the needs of the user application. If a listener is set external, the default button handling of this class is disabled.
        Parameters:
        listener - ButtonBarListener

        Removes a ButtonBarListener from this bar.

      • isOkValidated

        public boolean isOkValidated()
        Returns true if the "OK" (or "Close") button was pressed and the validation routines of any button-bar listeners have all returned true ("ok").

      • add

        public java.awt.Component add(java.awt.Component button)
        Adds a component to the button bar at the utmost TRAILING position. If the component is a JButton or a JComboBox then this button bar is added to its action event dispatcher.
        Overrides:
        add in class ButtonBar
        Parameters:
        button - the component to add
        Since:
        0-4-0

      • add

        public java.awt.Component add(java.awt.Component button,
                              int index)
        Adds a component to the button bar at the specified index position. If the component is a JButton or a JComboBox then this button bar is added to its action event dispatcher.
        Overrides:
        add in class ButtonBar
        Parameters:
        button - the component to add
        index - the position index of the new component
        Since:
        0-4-0
